original_text: We sat down next to each other, but David wouldn't look at me. He lowered his head what he was thinking. I had high hopes for him so I wanted to let him join the cross-country. I comforted him in a soothing voice: "you have work so hard for this event. I hope your work hard is rewarding, I will support you forever." My words like a warm stream rushed his being. David raised his eyes meet my eyes with his eyes sparkling with confident. David felt inspired. I was pleased beyond description that I can light his strong determination. David was thinking for a while, "I hope I can try it." He laughed, his eyes shining with excitement. I pulled him into my arms, "I believe you can do it." I watched as David moved up to the starting line with the other runners. But David still had butterflies in his stomach and his hands were sweaty. With starting competition. So nervous was him that he was slow.

overall_evaluation.brief_comment: 作文基本切题，情节连贯，语言表达尚可，但存在较多语法错误和用词不当，影响整体流畅性和准确性。

content.evidence: 通过描述David的紧张情绪和作者的鼓励，展现了人物心理变化。
从David犹豫到最终决定参赛，逻辑清晰，符合人物性格。

language.point: 使用比喻增强表达效果
language.evidence: My words like a warm stream rushed his being. 使用了生动的比喻。
如inspired, excited, nervous等词汇准确传达了情绪。

structure.description: 两个段落之间有明显的过渡，从对话到动作描写，结构完整。

content.description: 可以加入更多关于David身体状况或周围环境的细节，使场景更生动。

language.evidence: 如'He lowered his head what he was thinking'应为'He lowered his head, wondering what he was thinking.'
如'work so hard'应为'worked so hard'，'your work hard is rewarding'应为'your hard work will be rewarded'

structure.description: 部分句子之间缺乏连接词，导致阅读时略显生硬。

detailed_errors.original_sentence: He lowered his head what he was thinking.
detailed_errors.correction: He lowered his head, wondering what he was thinking.
detailed_errors.explanation: 原句缺少连接词，应使用现在分词wondering作伴随状语。
detailed_errors.advanced_suggestion: He lowered his head, lost in thought about whether he should run.

detailed_errors.original_sentence: I had high hopes for him so I wanted to let him join the cross-country.
detailed_errors.correction: I had high hopes for him, so I wanted to encourage him to join the cross-country team.
detailed_errors.explanation: cross-country后应加team，且let him join不如encourage him to join自然。
detailed_errors.advanced_suggestion: I had high hopes for him, so I gently encouraged him to join the cross-country team.

detailed_errors.original_sentence: you have work so hard for this event.
detailed_errors.correction: you have worked so hard for this event.
detailed_errors.explanation: have后应接过去分词，构成现在完成时。
detailed_errors.advanced_suggestion: you've put in so much effort for this event.

detailed_errors.original_sentence: I hope your work hard is rewarding
detailed_errors.correction: I hope your hard work will be rewarded.
detailed_errors.explanation: work hard是动词短语，不能作主语；应改为hard work（名词）。
detailed_errors.advanced_suggestion: I know your dedication will pay off.

detailed_errors.original_sentence: with his eyes sparkling with confident
detailed_errors.correction: with his eyes sparkling with confidence
detailed_errors.explanation: confident是形容词，此处需要名词confidence。
detailed_errors.advanced_suggestion: with his eyes glowing with quiet confidence

detailed_errors.original_sentence: So nervous was him that he was slow.
detailed_errors.correction: So nervous was he that he started slowly.
detailed_errors.explanation: 倒装句中主语应为he，且slow应为副词slowly修饰动词started。
detailed_errors.advanced_suggestion: So nervous was he that he hesitated at the starting line.

optimizations.original_sentence: My words like a warm stream rushed his being.
optimizations.correction: My words flowed like a warm stream, touching his soul.
optimizations.explanation: 将rushed his being改为touching his soul，更符合英语表达习惯，增强感染力。

optimizations.original_sentence: I was pleased beyond description that I can light his strong determination.
optimizations.correction: I was overjoyed to see that I could ignite his unwavering determination.
optimizations.explanation: pleased beyond description → overjoyed，light → ignite，determination → unwavering determination，提升语言层次。

optimizations.original_sentence: But David still had butterflies in his stomach and his hands were sweaty.
optimizations.correction: Yet David’s heart pounded with anxiety, and his palms grew clammy with nerves.
optimizations.explanation: butterflies in the stomach → heart pounded with anxiety，sweaty hands → palms grew clammy with nerves，更地道且富有画面感。

applicable_themes.description: David虽有身体障碍，但仍选择参赛，体现了坚持与勇气的主题。
老师对学生的鼓励和支持，展现了温暖的师生关系。
David面对比赛的紧张情绪，最终战胜自我，适合用于‘克服恐惧’主题。

material_reuse_guide.processing_direction: 可将此素材用于‘逆境中的成长’、‘信念的力量’等主题写作。
material_reuse_guide.expansion_ideas: 可扩展描写David的比赛过程、观众反应、比赛后的反思等，使故事更完整。

revised_text: We sat down next to each other, but David wouldn’t look at me. He lowered his head, wondering what he was thinking. I had high hopes for him, so I gently encouraged him to join the cross-country team. I comforted him in a soothing voice, 'You’ve worked so hard for this event. I hope your hard work will be rewarded. I’ll support you forever.' My words flowed like a warm stream, touching his soul. David raised his eyes to meet mine, his gaze sparkling with quiet confidence. He felt inspired. I was overjoyed to see that I could ignite his unwavering determination. After a moment of silence, he said, 'I hope I can try it.' He smiled, his eyes shining with excitement. I pulled him into my arms. 'I believe you can do it,' I whispered. I watched as David moved up to the starting line with the other runners. Yet David’s heart pounded with anxiety, and his palms grew clammy with nerves. So nervous was he that he hesitated at the starting line, but then took a deep breath and stepped forward, ready to face the challenge.
